column4: Hi guys, what would be a good linux remote destop client to connect to windows remote ?

depeneds on your ram. if swap will ever get used. :) in the old days yea. you could gain some speed by having swap on a differnt drive.  I used to put a little swap parittion on ever hd in the system. for even more gain
but these days. it most likely wont be noticeable  unless you have a real low end syste,
since I have those two hard drives, I figured, may as well use them both
what about if I had / on a different physical drive and had home on a different one too.. would that help you think?
you could even split up home so some users are on hd1 an dothers on hd2 if you wanted to
so you have your home directory on a conventionnal hard drive then?
my whole system is on a 32gb usb flash drive.
i dident want to mess with the partitons on this new pc. :)
never really counted..   bios post/messages and grub timeout is longer then boot time
theres a wine submenu item. or look in the wine dir.
I found the dir however I click the exe and nothing happens
use the cli to laumch it so you can see errors
